profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Eduard Dorsch (1822-1887) grew up in Germany. He emigrated to the United States in 1849, where he ran a successful practice as a physician in Monroe, Michigan, and wrote articles for several German-language newspapers. He also wrote poetry, painted and grew flowers. He willed his home and library collection to the city of Monroe to be used as a library.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of four manuscript volumes of poems in German. The titles are Aus der Alten und neuen welt, Untitled (poems), Politische and Religiose poems and Whipporwill. The three titled volumes indicate Edward Dorsh as author, though it is not known whether they in his hand or were copied out by someone else.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
